page.title: 06National Dawn Chorus Day.
page.content: Sunday, May 5th, 4.30a.m.was dark,wet, cold and windy but, not dismayed, we made our way up {Longstone Hill}over{ {Ladys Edge }down into {Hodders Combe.} Nothing stirred apart from resting sheep and feeding rabbits. Soon from the trees lining the stream could be heard {blackbirds} and {robins, }the {pheasants }call and the everlasting {cuckoo. }The chorus was soon joined by the {wren, } various{ {warblers }and {tits }and the persistent {wood pigeon.}Conspicuous by his silence after yesterdays performance was the {green woodpecker. Many summer visitors are late arriving perhaps due to the cold spring. The light shining through the young birch and beech leaves made them appear translucent.A group of Red Deer moved silently away. The rain had stopped and it was a good day.
